Author: riseandshaheen
Content:
ğŸ‘‹ ***Hey! ***

*Did we miss a channel for your favorite language? If there is enough demand, we'll make it happen. Until then, this channel is a good place for discussions on all other languages. :)*

Check out our rollups-examples repo https://github.com/cartesi/rollups-examples

Author: fabio.oshiro
Content: my friend asked if there is any java support...

Author: lynofz
Content:
Hey @fabio.oshiro 
Currently we haven't ported the jvm to the cartesi machine. If you have an attractive app, we'll consider porting it.

Author: fabio.oshiro
Content: and nodejs?

Author: dtuler
Content: Nodejs is still unsupported but is in our medium term goals. However we have support for JavaScript, through another JS engine. Check the rollups-examples, there is an echo-js

Author: glockchain
Content: Any behind the scenes work on getting Golang into the ctsi-machine.

Author: riseandshaheen
Content: We plan to run tests with Golang once weâ€™ve implemented the microarchitecture and other RISC-V extensions. Weâ€™ll release an example as soon as weâ€™re satisfied with its performance inside the Cartesi Machine.

Author: richardcipher
Content: Will it ever be possible to run springboot on a Cartesi?

Author: riseandshaheen
Content: Springboot is a Java-based framework. Anything in this direction could only be thought once we have JVM ported inside the Cartesi Machine.

Author: richardcipher
Content: Is that in the works?

Author: riseandshaheen
Content: Not really, but if you have some cool idea in mind or an open source Java library that makes sense to port to Cartesi Machine! We could possibly think of putting effort into it!

Author: richardcipher
Content: I'd be willing to contribute to the code as well. Let me think on this.

Author: dtuler
Content:
my lua dapp works with lua 5.3, but not with lua 5.4. Some incompatibility with luasocket. I get the error below. Any idea @edubart ?
```
lua: /usr/share/lua/5.4/socket/http.lua:41: bad argument #1 to 'receive' (string expected, got light userdata)
stack traceback:
 [C]: in function 'socket.http.request'
 /opt/cartesi/dapp/dapp.lua:14: in local 'http_post'
 /opt/cartesi/dapp/dapp.lua:47: in main chunk
 [C]: in ?
```

Author: edubart
Content: Does @diego.nehab still give support for LuaSocket?  He created it ğŸ™‚ . LuaSocket was ported to Lua5.4 right? Any API changed in 5.4?

Author: dtuler
Content: I think it's a bug that happens with 5.4.4 (which is the version for ubuntu 22.04. http://lua-users.org/lists/lua-l/2021-06/msg00101.html

Author: dtuler
Content: https://github.com/lunarmodules/luasocket/issues/331

Author: edubart
Content: I see, looks like that is the problem, it was fixed in LuaSocket 3.1, but Ubuntu provides 3.0 ğŸ˜• . I guess you will need to use LuaRocks after all to workaround this and install with `luarocks install --lua-version=5.4 luasocket`, have a C compiler, maybe use a multi-stage build, it's more painful.

Author: edubart
Content: Or stick with Lua5.3 .. Sadly

Author: dtuler
Content: I think I'll stick with lua5.3. LuaRocks does not play nicely with lua5.4 either. Its ubuntu package is not updated to depend on lua5.4, so it's kind of a mess.

Author: dtuler
Content: I mean, I'm sure I could make it work.

Author: edubart
Content: @diego.nehab any opinion on how should we recommend using Lua in rollups examples? With 5.3 or 5.4? With LuaRocks or Ubuntu packages? With luasocket or something else?

Author: edubart
Content: Sad that the Ubuntu package managers leave some part of the Lua 5.4 ecosystem broken in their packages.

Author: dtuler
Content:
@diego.nehab linked to this https://github.com/cartesi/machine-emulator/blob/14ad23327865adbc4d4d0761687ae4783feb4315/.github/workflows/Dockerfile#L13
Which is still using 5.3. Let's see what kind of problem will happen there. You have a working branch for 5.4, right?

Author: edubart
Content: Yes, I have a working branch that I ported machine-emulator to use Lua 5.4 already, and it works on Ubuntu/Debian, but this in x86_64 host.

Author: dtuler
Content:
I see you do, `feature/update-lua5.4`
And you have `lua5.4 liblua5.4-dev luarocks`
This `luarocks` will bring `lua5.1` with him.

Author: edubart
Content: But that is not a problem, just the default Lua that comes with it, luarocks is supposed to work and capable of installing packages for all Lua versions.

Author: dtuler
Content: Yeah, I just need to do that on a build stage, to not mess with the runtime stage with two lua versions.

Author: dtuler
Content: It works ğŸ‘

Content: curious that the http agent is `LuaSocket 3.0.0`, not `LuaSocket 3.1.0`

Author: dtuler
Content: variable was not updated.

looks like to be another issue from LuaRocks

Author: cynthiaro
Content:
Hi @Glowinthedark, this channel makes references to other programming languages. If you want to connect with Cartesi's Turkish community, please join us here https://t.me/CartesiTR and follow Cartesi Turkey on Twitter as well https://twitter.com/CartesiTurkiye. 

Also, if you are eager to build with Cartesi, you'll be pleased to know that in November, we'll be participating in ETHGlobal Istanbul, and we'd be happy to see you at the hackathon: https://ethglobal.com/events/istanbul

Author: glowinthetrade
Content: If you are interested, I can be a MOD for Turkish language accounts in your community.
